section.title: Calc|Animate
section.para: This dialog is used to create an animation by changing a custom constant. The animation can be played directly, saved to a file or copied into a document. The animation can contain all elements supported by Graph, for example functions, relations, point series, labels, etc.

varlistentry.listitem: Here you select which constant you want to change in the animation. The constant must already have been created in the Custom functions dialog. The selected constant will be changed in each frame in the animation.

You need to specify the range of the selected constant in the animation. The Step value indicates how much the constant is changed between two frames. The number of frames is given by (To - From) / Step. More frames will give a smoother animation but it will also take longer to create and take up more space in the disk file.

listitem.para: You can specify the image size of the animation. This will affect the file size and the time it takes to create the animation. The Frames per second indicates the default speed of the animation. Most players will be able to adjust the speed when the animation is played.

When you press the Animate button, an animation is created from the settings you have specified. This may take some time depending on what elements exist in the coordinate system and how many frames are needed.

When the animation is finished, a very simple player is shown. You can use this to play the animation. The rightmost button will give you some additional options, for example to save the animation to a file, which can be played by any media player. You can also have the player repeat playing the animation until you stop it. The Auto reverse option will make the animation run backwards when it reaches the end. This is very useful in combination with the Repeat option to make the animation oscillate between the two ends. You can also make some changes to the speed, though a more accurate speed needs to be set before the animation is created.
